remarks: For each nonnegative integer K there are either no edges having degree K, or all vertices have degree K in a friendship graph, unless there is a universal friend.  This corresponds to claim 2 in [Huneke] p. 2: "Suppose there is a vertex of degree k > 1. ... all vertices have degree k, unless there is a universal friend. ...  It follows that G is k-regular, i.e., the degree of every vertex is k".  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Jan-2018.)
